intro: Dionysia drabifolia, commonly known as the drab yew, is a species of flowering plant in the family Calyceraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous white or greenish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, and the plant often forms dense mats or low shrubs. Dionysia drabifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
